title: AlarmGlobals (GVL)
text:
This GVL must be initialized before GVL âGloballyForAlarmStorageâ, because this GVL
causes the initialization of the variable g_stApplicationName.
We only need the date and time format pattern for the converted code, therefore
we can (and must!) omit the rest from conversion
We must not use an attribute to hide this GVL, because there are some variables,
that a developer might use. Additionally it is necessary, that this GVL in considered
in the data server, but not visible for the user, because some variables of this GVL
are added to the data source selection implicitely and for this purpose it is necessary,
that this GVL is a part of the available items tree.

rows.Name: g_AlarmHandler
rows.Comment:
This global instance provides API functionality to manipulate or retrieve
alarm configuration objects. For more information see IAlarmHandler interfaces.

rows.Name: g_diAlarmStateTransitionCounter
rows.Comment:
A global counter, that counts all the alarm state transitions, that occur.
Needed by the alarm table for optimized painting. If this counter doesnât
change during subsequent paint calls, the same alarms have been active and
in the same state.
Conditional show attribute must not be present for this variable, because
some architectural problems it can lead in a not correct regitrationCHECKED_OMIT

rows.Name: g_diAlarmStorageCounter
rows.Comment:
A similar counter, that will be incremented each time an alarm is written
into the alarm storage. This allows the alarm table to detect, whether
some kind of processing has to be done, because there exists a new alarm.
Conditional show attribute must not be present for this variable, because
some architectural problems it can lead in a not correct regitrationCHECKED_OMIT

rows.Name: g_sDateFormat
rows.Comment: The date format used to format the date part of a timestamp

rows.Name: g_sTimeFormat
rows.Comment: The time format used to format the date part of a timestamp

rows.Name: g_StorageTaskInfo
rows.Comment:
Info object for the alarm storage task. Contains information
about task state and cycle times.

rows.Name: g_xStepByStepMode
rows.Comment: Activates the progressive loading of the alarm history.

rows.Name: g_tStepByStepLimit
rows.Comment: Sets the time limit per loading step.

rows.Name: g_iAlarmConfigurationUpdateCounter
rows.Comment:
Increment this variable if a change is made to the
AlarmConfig at runtime, it reloads the AlarmTable.
